sub_tasks.requirements: Chart Instantiation and Configuration
The system provides a primary Chart object that encapsulates all state and functionality for a single chart instance with canvas element and configuration object.
A core configuration object (type, data, options, plugins) defines the initial state and behavior of the chart instance.
Installation and integration methods for incorporating Chart.js into applications (npm, bundlers, script tags).
Chart Instance API and Control
Manages rendering and re-rendering through render() and update() methods with configurable update modes.
Provides methods for resource cleanup and instance destruction (destroy(), clear()).
Supports dynamic data manipulation (add/remove) and visibility toggling (hide/show methods).
Allows for programmatic interaction with chart elements (getElementsAtEventForMode, setActiveElements).
Component Registry System
A static registry manages all available components (charts, scales, plugins) that can be instantiated.
Supports dynamic registration and unregistration of components, enabling tree-shaking and custom extensions.
Hierarchical Options Resolution
Options are resolved from global defaults, to chart-specific defaults, to dataset-level options, and finally to element-specific options.
Specific components like scales, plugins, titles, and tooltips have their own dedicated option scopes.
Dynamic Options System
Scriptable options are functions that receive a context object (chart, dataset, dataIndex) and return a value, allowing for data-dependent configuration.
Indexable options are arrays that map values to elements by their index.
Visual Configuration
Color management, patterns, gradients, and visual styling options with multiple color formats.
Chart layout, padding, and spacing configuration.
Global configuration for elements (points, lines, bars, arcs) that can be overridden at lower levels.
Cartesian Charts
Bar Charts with vertical and horizontal orientations, stacking capabilities, and comprehensive styling options.
Line Charts with point styling, line styling, area filling capabilities, and stacked area support.
Scatter and Bubble Charts for displaying relationships between variables with point-based visualization.
Radial Charts
Pie and Doughnut Charts for displaying proportional data with circular visualization.
Polar and Radar Charts for multi-dimensional data visualization with radial coordinate systems.
Mixed Chart Types
Capability to combine multiple chart types in a single visualization by associating different controllers with different datasets.
Chart-specific behaviors like line interpolation, bar stacking, and pie/doughnut segment calculation.
Layout Engine
Organizes and positions all chart components (canvas, axes, legend, title) within the available space.
Manages padding and responsive resizing of the chart canvas and its internal drawing area.
Scale System
Modular Scale subsystem that maps data values to pixel coordinates on the canvas with extensible base interface.
Cartesian coordinate systems with Linear, Category, Time/TimeSeries, and Logarithmic scales.
Radial coordinate systems for circular chart types with specialized configuration options.
Each scale generates its own ticks, grid lines, and labels based on configuration and data range.
Supports stacking of values across multiple datasets on a single axis.
Dataset Controllers
Chart type logic encapsulated in Dataset Controllers that manage drawing of specific visual representations.
Each controller interprets dataset properties and creates/updates primitive drawing elements (e.g., BarController creates bar elements).
Auxiliary UI Components
Tooltip system with interaction modes, positioning, content customization, and extensive callbacks.
Legend system that generates items based on chart datasets and handles user interactions to toggle dataset visibility.
Title configuration and positioning within the chart layout.
Common Scale Configuration
Universal configuration options available to all axis types with common options and default scales.
Tick configuration including marks, labels, and formatting across all axes.
Axis Styling and Labeling
Visual customization of axes including grid lines, borders, and scale titles.
Date adapters for time-based scales that parse and format various date formats independently of specific date/time libraries.
Data Ingestion and Structures
Flexible data ingestion system that accepts multiple data structures (arrays of primitives, objects, etc.).
Configurable parsing engine that maps properties from custom data objects to internal chart values (x, y, r).
Data Normalization and Processing
Data is normalized into an internal, consistent format used by controllers and scales.
Performance Optimization
Data decimation module for performance optimization by reducing data points before rendering.
Multiple decimation algorithms (LTTB, Min/Max) for different optimization strategies.
Performance best practices for data parsing, normalization, and rendering with large datasets.
Event System
Captures canvas events (mousemove, click) and translates them into chart-specific interactions.
Interaction modes (point, nearest, index, dataset) define logic for finding and targeting chart elements from event coordinates.
Helper functions to convert event coordinates to data values on a given scale.
Animation System
Core animation engine that manages visual transitions between chart states with configurable easing functions.
Distinct animation configurations for different chart update scenarios (initial render, resize, data update).
Animation lifecycle callbacks (onProgress, onComplete) for advanced effects.
Plugin API and Usage
Robust Plugin API that allows developers to hook into chart lifecycle to add custom functionality or modify behavior.
Lifecycle hooks at critical points including before/after initialization, updates, rendering, and destruction.
Plugins can be registered globally or per-chart basis with their own configuration scope.
Custom Component Development
System designed for extensibility allowing developers to create and register new chart types and axis types.
New components created by extending base controller and scale classes and implementing defined interfaces.
Custom axis development with scale properties and interface implementation.
Framework Integration
Integration with popular JavaScript frameworks and build tools with bundle optimization.
Responsive Design and Accessibility
Responsive chart behavior and device compatibility with configuration options.
Accessibility features and best practices for inclusive chart design.
Migration and Versioning
Version migration guides and compatibility information for end users.
